title: Tank Ekko Balance question: Why was the "More AP = More Slows" change got scrapped?
body:
I remembered back before in PBE, Riot made a change where Ekko's Q slow would scale harder the more AP he builds, so that way, his Tank identity would become much weaker & less noticing. Here I even made a thread about it & got tons of other people supporting it too:

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/fqte12EI-ekkos-nerfs-on-pbe-were-on-point

The idea of this balance was suggested by a certain League player, and I swore there was a Meddler comment stating that he thinks it's an interesting idea & wanted to apply it to PBE as soon as possible.

But then again, the idea was completely removed as they proceeded to the "less base damage & more AP scaling" idea, which until now doesn't seem to be effective at all. Hell, even I witnessed an LCS Ekko building Trinity Force out of nowhere.

So let me ask again, especially to Riot. Why was the idea about making slows more stronger from building more AP got scrapped off from PBE before?

replies.body: It feels like Ekko is building literally everything else other than AP right now. I've seen several tanks and AD ekkos recently, but no AP builds. It's just hilarious. Since riot won't make good changes (like this one) to him, his build paths go everywhere but where they should be.

It's because he has way too much incentive to stick around instead of quickly getting in and out like a normal assassin. His Q is slow, his W is slow, his 3 hit passive forces him to sit there and whack a target 3 times. There's ultimately just no way you can make a kit like that good on an assassin without making it even better on a bruiser or tank.

We were really interested in the idea of AP scaling Ekko's slow as a way to appropriately reward AP builds, while removing some problems from tank or bruiser builds. We ended up going with different changes though after testing the change and finding it didn't do what we'd hoped. In particular:

* Tank Ekko still functioned really well, even with reduced slow strength. Tankier builds have an easier time triggering the passive slow, can take bigger risks with the W and, at least at the time, almost always had the IBG slow in there as well. 

* AP Ekko by contrast's much more reliant on stronger slows, his fallback pattern (utility for team, even if he can't kill people himself) especially. Putting AP scaling on slow strength therefore made AP Ekko much more feast/famine based off his gold income, without addressing tank Ekko much.

We do still see tank/bruiser Ekko as having some problems and are planning to do further work on him as a result, with the goal of pushing him towards an assassin or skirmisher playstyle. Current expectation is that those changes will happen in the pre-season patch with the changes to a number of other assassins or champs with strong assassin qualities.
Will he get any big changes to his kit or mostly number changes? I know he wasn't apart of the "big 4" but I'm just curious.
Probably just number changes, could well be quite a few of them though.

If I may suggest something... Why not do a ratio shift on his E?

If I remember correctly, Tank Ekko relies on base damages and Iceborn Gauntlets. A lot of power still comes off from his E, despite being an auto attack reset and applying on hit effects; hitting his E's base damage and shifting it to ratio may shift power in the right direction since his empowered auto attack from his E would not hurt as much, allowing for more breathing room for his opponents while also making AP Ekko's initiation much more powerful.

That's just my current thoughts on the matter though. The only other thing I can think of is lowering the slow on his passive and boosting the speed up that it gives (Tank Ekko has no trouble sticking to a target, the slow just puts the final nail in the coffin with the iceborn), so that AP ekkos can escape fights more easily while tank ekko's victims would not be slowed down (being able to separate the tank ekko from his allies rather than his victim from his enemies.)

Can you guys take a look at trying to disincentivize building tank on Ekko at all? Like, reducing his shield strength base and put it into his AP scaling? I think a big problem is that Ekko's W gives him extra tankiness regardless and it shouldn't protect him if he's already building tank.

Considering he's an effective tank, is there anything wrong in balancing him around being one? 

i.e. nerfing his ult, reducing his scaling damage as well; Basically realizing that perhaps if the community is building him tanky bruiser style, then simply treat him as a bruiser and approach it as so rather than as really really wanting an AP Utility Assassin. I understand that you believe Assassin Ekko is healthier and want to keep him there, but with the kit he has -- it's not easily feasible. 

 There are future possibilities for one such champion, but this one doesn't need to be it. It's clearly evolved into something else and is probably best to learn from it and adapt the champion to what he has become in terms of balance rather than shift him into what he was envisioned to be after all the time and effort it is taking. Just a thought, but it seems very forced at this point to continue to approach the problem in a linear way.
Have you ever considered disabling the items he abuses until this problem is solved? If not why so?

That one's easy. Disabling items is something of a "nuclear option" as it has a large impact on other champions and the game as a whole besides Ekko. Say they do that with {{item:3742}} , now every champion who relies on {{item:3742}} as a core item is going to struggle while Ekko can still build other tank items. Do that with every item and there would be practically no Bruiser or Tank build paths left for any champion. 

The only reason I could see for Riot disabling an item is if it had some sort of horrifically gamebreaking bug attached to purchasing it on the majority of champions.

Why not just accept that he's a bruiser/fighter/tankier character and optimize for that rather than trying to crowbar him into that weird "skirmish assassin" role?  That never made any sense!  Prolonged fighters need to be tanky to survive the fact that their damage is slow but dangerous.  

You're trying to make a role idea that is at war with itself.
wait arent assassin suppsoed to be feast or famine

It boils down to having a ridiculous amount of utility in his kit that just makes it attractive to build him as a bruiser/tank right now with all the mobility on top of it, and how hard it is to finish him off with his ult.

It is like people going bruiser/tank build on Yasuo right now. When you end up with a good amount of utility AND mobility, it is very easy to abuse other builds. The problems are with the overloaded kits of both champs, and the way items seem to be balanced in a vacuum before going live with as easy as they are to abuse. 

I mean, I'm even building tank support Thresh and with his souls and kit I can just become a tanky beast to rival most other ACTUAL tank supports, plus somehow do damage.

> Tankier builds have an easier time triggering the passive slow

Then, did you try the AP-scaling slow approach on the passive slow instead of the Q slow? That still leaves stronger Q slows from range to even a famined squishy AP Ekko, and should impact Tankko more, no? Or am I missing some important detail?

Taking a step back, I know Ekko was designed as an assassin/skirmisher and I love playing him that way, but is it possible that Ekko should just be redesigned/rebalanced as a tank? His skills as they exist right now are a target agnostic damage increase that encourages him to engage for a long period of time, an unreliable slow in a large area, a reliable slow/unreliable stun with a shield attached again in a large area, a positioning tool, and a massive heal + positioning tool. The passive is built for bruisers (like Jax or Vi), two of the skills are pretty clearly built for tanks (q and w) and the ultimate is pretty unreliable as far as assassin positioning goes while the large heal is very potent for tanks. It seems to me like Ekko's kit is just a better tank kit than it is an assassin kit. The tools he has are just better for locking down large areas and surviving to hit whoever is near him than they are for carefully selecting a single target and removing them from the map. Furthermore, trying to design a champion to be an unreliable assassin seems like a losing proposition. The only possible outcomes are a reliable assassin, an underpowered assassin, or some other class which cares less about the unreliable nature of the skills. Rather than try to force Ekko to be something he isn't and really can not be with his current kit, let him be something new (like tank jungle Vi, which is a perfectly acceptable solution to the same basic problem).

It was a mistake to give a champion so much; mobility, crowd control, safety, base damage & scaling damage. The whole utility assassin concept cannot end well without being crippled, similar to evelynn & irelia. I don't mind champions having versatile build paths; but when they can clearly build against their class & still perform better than alternative champions of their class, something has gone over the top with design. For those of you who remember the super sustain crazy burst magic master yi, is another example, and mage yi was nerfed into nonexistence by swapping out the ratio types. I suspect ekko is another one of those problematic champions that will always be an issue, until reworked or significantly changed in some fashion to streamline a more intended build.
